submitter_user.about: Hi, I'm [Peter Bhat Harkins](https://malaprop.org), a programmer and entrepreneur from Chicago. From June 2014 to winter of 2015 I typically posted a dozen stories per day to [help](https://lobste.rs/s/9pm09z/what_is_on_topic_what_is_not/comments/nie0yn#c_nie0yn) the site reach a critical mass of regular visitors. In October 2017 I became the site administrator after the site creator @jcs stepped down. * Please don‚Äôt message me for an invitation if we're complete strangers; check the user list for someone you know or ask [in chat](https://lobste.rs/chat). * Submit a [`meta`](https://lobste.rs/t/meta) post for feature requests (including new tags) to let the community discuss. Bug reports and "is this a bug?" should go to [the issue tracker](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/issues). * [Message me](https://lobste.rs/messages?to=pushcx) for administrative and moderator things. I don't see everything and I gotta sleep sometime. * E-mail my first name @malaprop.org regarding site security or if you can't log in to message me. If I've posted or commented about something here or in the chat room, I'd almost certainly love to talk more about it.

title: That Time I Tried Porting Zig to SerenityOS

submitter_user.about:
```
> 220 ground-control.nasa.gov ESMTP sendmail
< HELO shuttle.nasa.gov
> 250 ground-control.nasa.gov Take your protein pills, and put your helmet on
> 250 ground-control.nasa.gov Commencing countdown, engines on
> 250 ground-control.nasa.gov Check ignition, and may god's love be with you
< MAIL FROM:<major-tom@shuttle.nasa.gov>
> 250 Ok
< RCPT TO:<postmaster@ground-control.nasa.gov>
> 250 Ok
< DATA
> 354 End data with <CR><LF>.<CR><LF>
< I'm stepping through the door
< And I'm floating in the most peculiar way
< And the stars look very different today
< For here am I sitting in my tin can
< Far above the world
< Planet Earth is blue
< And there's nothing I can do

< Though I'm past one hundred thousand miles
< I'm feeling very still
< And I think my spaceship knows which way to go
< Tell my wife I love her very much, she knows
< .
> 420 ground-control.nasa.gov Your circuit's dead, there's something wrong
> 420 ground-control.nasa.gov Can you hear me, Major Tom?
> 420 ground-control.nasa.gov Can you hear me, Major Tom?
> 420 ground-control.nasa.gov Can you hear me, Major Tom?
Connection closed by remote host.
major-tom@shuttle:~$ # And I'm floating around my tin can
major-tom@shuttle:~$ # Far above the Moon
major-tom@shuttle:~$ # Planet Earth is blue
major-tom@shuttle:~$ # And there's nothing I can do
major-tom@shuttle:~$ ^Dexit
```

title: Text Generation with a Grammar in LispE

submitter_user.about: I have been working for years on Natural Language parsing technology, implementing a tool: XIP (Xerox Incremental Parser) that was used in my research team for over 16 years. As NLP was quickly shifting into Deep Learning, I moved my interest to programming languages, which appeared to me as a natural continuation of my work on grammars. I have so far implemented two languages, which are now in Open Source: Tamgu and LispE (github.com/naver/tamgu and github.com/naver/lispe).
